DataElement.preferredName: Patient Resectable Neoplasm And Pretreatment Biopsy Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient has resectable disease and has consented to a biopsy that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Resectable Neoplasm And Pretreatment Biopsy Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Capable of being removed by surgery._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._Permission to do something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Resectable Neoplasm And Pretreatment Biopsy Consent Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Capable of being removed by surgery.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Permission to do something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Capable of being removed by surgery.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is biopsiable disease present
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is biopsiable disease present and patient is willing to undergo pre-treatment biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is biopsiable disease present and patient is willing to undergo pre-treatment and on-treatment biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient agree to a pre-treatment biopsy or is willing to provide an archival FFPE specimen for confirmation of an IDH1 or IDH2 mutation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has archival tumor material for research been submitted to the ETCTN Biorepository and does patient agree to undergo a research tumor biopsy before treatment if lesions are easily accessible (judged by the treating physician)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Phase 2 only: Does patient agree to planned pre-treatment and on-treatment biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex- 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable and biopsiable disease (at least two lesions) per RECIST v1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Escalation: If patient has CRC, is patient willing and able to undergo a pre-treatment biopsy?
